titlestmt.titleproper: A Finding Aid to the Sam Maloof Papers, 1954-2003, in the Archives of American Art
titlestmt.author: Sarah Mundy

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-03 14:07:48 -0400.

did.abstract: The papers of woodworker and furniture maker Sam Maloof measure 0.2 linear feet and date from 1954 to 2003. The collection consists of clippings and miscellaneous printed materials related to Maloof and woodworking, as well as photocopies of correspondence between Maloof and Jimmy and Rosalynn Carter.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Sam Maloof (1916-2009) was a woodworker and furniture maker in Alta Loma, California.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Due to the small size of this collection, the papers are arranged as one series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers of woodworker and furniture maker Sam Maloof measure 0.2 linear feet and date from 1954 to 2003. The collection consists of clippings and miscellaneous printed materials related to Maloof and woodworking, as well as photocopies of correspondence between Maloof and Jimmy and Rosalynn Carter.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Archives of American Art makes its archival collections available for non-commercial, educational and personal use unless restricted by copyright and/or donor restrictions, including but not limited to access and publication restrictions. AAA makes no representations concerning such rights and restrictions and it is the user's responsibility to determine whether rights or restrictions exist and to obtain any necessary permission to access, use, reproduce and publish the collections. Please refer to the Smithsonian's Terms of Use for additional information.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research. Access to original papers requires an appointment and is limited to the Archives' Washington, D.C. Research Center.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The Sam Maloof papers were donated in 2003 by Sam Maloof as part of the Nanette L. Laitman Documentation Project for Craft and the Decorative Arts in America.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Also in the Archives of American Art is an interview of Sam Maloof conducted January 10-12, 2002 by Mary MacNaughton for the Archives of American Art in Maloof's home/studio in Alta Loma, California.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Sam Maloof papers, 1954-2003. Archives of American Art, Smithsonian Institution.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The collection was processed, and a finding aid prepared by Sarah Mundy in 2022.

American studio craft movement

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series consists of clippings and miscellaneous printed materials related to Maloof and woodworking, as well as photocopies of correspondence between Maloof and Jimmy and Rosalynn Carter.
